meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The thieves were despoiling the house of its treasures.
meanings.sent2: The invaders were despoiling the village of its riches.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons were despoiling the picnic basket of its goodies.
meanings.sent4: The storm was despoiling the landscape of its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The vandals were despoiling the museum of its precious artifacts.

meanings.sent1: The pirates were despoiling the merchant ships of their cargo.
meanings.sent2: The bandits were despoiling the travelers of their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The kids were despoiling the cookie jar of its treats.
meanings.sent4: The hackers were despoiling the bank accounts of their funds.
meanings.sent5: The wolves were despoiling the henhouse of its chickens.

meanings.definition: To ruin or destroy by force
meanings.sent1: The vandals were despoiling the park benches with graffiti.
meanings.sent2: The war despoiled the once peaceful town.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was despoiling the sandcastle with glee.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake despoiled the city's infrastructure.
meanings.sent5: The fire despoiled the forest of its lush greenery.
